description:
Here is a fall I explored a long time ago and I guess I forgot to trailpeak it!  This is a hike on some logging roads and then some bushwacking to two different falls on a small brook near Coldstream.  The walk on the road is not very memorable and then the bushwack was in some small areas not super pleasant with lots of closely packed evergreens.  But with any luck those have grown and are now more spaced apart or find another route to the stream or maybe someone cut a trail?

The fall I found was a slider type fall not super impressive but a fellow explorer Andrew Hooper followed my picture and actually found a better waterfall just a few hundred metres upstream of mine.  The lesson here…never give up, don’t turn around, you never know ..a hidden gem might be just ahead.  Thanks Andrew for letting me know what I had missed!
directions: On Coldstream Road, park and hike the logging road at; N45° 04' 01.5" W63° 19' 11.9", this logging road is on the east side of the road, 200m to the north of the intersection with St Andrews River Rd.    First fall is at;  N45° 03' 38.8" W63° 18' 16.1"and Andrew’s is at N45° 03' 40.6" W63° 18' 01.8".
title: Coldstream Falls
